title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Sharing Stories
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Sharing Stories            Sharing Stories       In 2016 the National Park Service will turn 100 years old!  Our centennial is a unique opportunity introduce the National Park Service to a new generation of Americans. Read the stories below to meet the staff here at Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park.        NPS photo  Lisa Cassidy, known as L.C., is a preservationist here at Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park.         NPS photo  Si Dennis has been a maintenance worker with Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park for decades.  His family has lived in the area since before the Gold Rush!         Drawing by Bruce Dansby  Cindy Von Halle, Chief of Interpretation, has found a home with the National Park Service in many places around the country.         NPS photo  Greg Clem never thought he would end up with his job as work, but each summer thousands of people are glad he does!         NPS photo  Tegan Baldwin, Administrative Support Assistant, helps keep Klondike Gold Rush running and has found a new family in the process.
